Description

Little Things Get Damaged is a minimalist physics game inspired by marble maze games. 

The object of the game is to take the marble out of the maze. The twist is that the marble gets damaged if it hits things too fast or gets crushed by a heavier object.  Try to get a better grade by solving the levels without taking damage!

This game was made in 9 days for the LTGD: Let's Talk Game Jam 2022. The theme of the jam was to make a game with the acronym LTGD. We thought the title Little Things Get Damaged was cute and gave a lot of room for a poetic interpretation. What if the small things to protect were precious emotions that one risks losing as they age? What if life was represented with a maze?
